intro: Ortholoma incarnatum, commonly known as the redstem ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across its native range. Ortholoma incarnatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
